title: Will humans live to 1 million years? - Quora

response.answer_text: I cannot imagine such a event. What would happen to the population? As I pointed out before, the brain is so complex, and vast with 85 billion neurons, that’s just neurons. There’s lot of other cells that are essential. Even if the aging process could be frozen, you can’t just replace neurons. The total replacement percentage over a lifetime is about .02 % I have read maybe .04%. Any more would result in dysfuction of the organism.

As individuals? Not without changing to something very different to what we think as “human”. Here is a science fiction book which gives an inkling into what is involved: House of Suns - Kindle edition by Alastair Reynolds
DO you mean to the year 1 million or the the age of 1 Million years. As a group, maybe YES. Individually, probably NO.
That matters upon if anybody screwed anything up while they are time traveling I imagine the laws got pretty damn strict on who when and where going back in time
